alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 7:35AM EST until November 22 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Wet snow and some sleet. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch for a storm total of 3 to 5 inches and sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Belknap and Merrimack Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...A weather system is bringing snow changing to rain and a wintry mix to the region this morning. Slushy accumulations and a glaze of ice are causing slippery roadways. A change to rain is then expected with improvement to travel conditions by 11 AM.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
